intro: Verbascum faik-karaveliogullarii, commonly known as the Faik Karaveliogullari's mullein, is a rare species of flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the genus Verbascum, which includes several species of flowering plants known for their large, showy flowers. This particular species is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in arid and rocky environments, showcasing adaptations to its harsh native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and unique features, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
